questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: He's clearing off the desk.
He's e-mailing a friend.
He's putting up notices on the wall.
He's sitting in front of the fax machine.
questions.script:
（A）He's clearing off the desk.
（B）He's e-mailing a friend.
（C）He's putting up notices on the wall.
（D）He's sitting in front of the fax machine.
（A）他在清理桌子。
（B）他在给朋友发邮件。
（C）他正把通知贴到墙上去。
（D）他坐在传真机前面。

481

他坐在书桌旁。
·He is working at the keyboard.
他正在使用键盘。
·He is working with a computer.
他正在使用电脑。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: One man is giving a speech in a conference hall.
All of the men are watching television.
One of the men is talking into the microphone.
They are holding a conversation over coffee.
questions.script:
（A）One man is giving a speech in a conference hall.
（B）All of the men are watching television.
（C）One of the men is talking into the microphone.
（D）They are holding a conversation over coffee.
（A）一位男士正在会议厅里做演讲。
（B）所有的人都在看电视。
（C）其中一个人在对着话筒讲话。
（D）他们一边交谈一边喝咖啡。
·One man is being interviewed.
一位男士正在被采访。
·An interview is taking place at the moment.
现在正在进行一场采访。
·The man being interviewed is speaking into a microphone.
被采访的男士正对着话筒讲话。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The women are waiting for the bus to arrive.
They're lining up to board the bus.
Some of them are walking toward the bus.
The people have already gotten off the bus.
questions.script:
（A）The women are waiting for the bus to arrive.
（B）They're lining up to board the bus.
（C）Some of them are walking toward the bus.
（D）The people have already gotten off the bus.
（A）女士们正在等公交车。
（B）她们正在排队上公交车。
（C）她们中的一些人正走向公交车。
（D）人们已经下了公交车。
·They are walking away from the bus.
她们正从公交车那里走开。
·The women are dressed for warm weather.
女士们都穿着暖和天气里穿的衣服。
·Some of them are carrying bags.
482

她们中的一些人拿着包。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The man is leaning over the long table.
The man is sorting through the pile of books.
The man is stacking the books on the shelves.
The man is looking to make a purchase.
questions.script:
（A）The man is leaning over the long table.
（B）The man is sorting through the pile of books.
（C）The man is stacking the books on the shelves.
（D）The man is looking to make a purchase.
（A）男士正靠在长桌上。
（B）男士正在整理一堆书。
（C）男士正把书堆放到书架上。
（D）男士正在浏览，打算购买。
·Some books have been stacked up in front of the man.
一些书已经堆放在男士面前。
·The man is holding a book in front of him.
男士在他面前举着一本书。
·He has picked up a book from the pile.
他从一堆书中拿起一本。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: One of the women has a hat on.
The women are riding their bicycles.
The bicyclists are locking up their bikes.
They have stopped to get something from the store.
questions.script:
（A）One of the women has a hat on.
（B）The women are riding their bicycles.
（C）The bicyclists are locking up their bikes.
（D）They have stopped to get something from the store.
（A）其中一位女士戴着帽子。
（B）女士们在骑自行车。
（C）骑自行车的人正在锁车。
（D）她们停下来到商店买东西。
·The women have gotten off their bicycles.
女士们已经从自行车上下来了。
·They are standing next to the bicycles.
她们正站在自行车旁边。
·The bicycles are loaded with some goods.
自行车上载着一些货物。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: Some customers are entering the store.
The store clerk is cleaning the store with a broom.
Some goods have been hung on a rack outside of the store. 483
The floor of the store is being mopped.
questions.script:
（A）Some customers are entering the store.
（B）The store clerk is cleaning the store with a broom.
（C）Some goods have been hung on a rack outside of the store.
483

（D）The floor of the store is being mopped.
（A）一些顾客正往商店里走。
（B）店员正在用扫帚清扫商店。
（C）一些商品被挂在商店外面的架子上了。
（D）有人正在拖商店的地板。
·Some items are on display outside the store.
商店外面展示了一些物品。
·The brooms have been put on a rack.
扫帚被放到架子上了。
·There is a rack full of goods.
有一个装满货物的架子。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: How much is the bus ride to the airport?
options: Thirty minutes from here.
One will be leaving soon.
Five dollars for adults. 坐大巴到机场需要多少钱？
questions.script:
How much is the bus ride to the airport?
（A）Thirty minutes from here.
（B）One will be leaving soon.
（C）Five dollars for adults.
坐大巴到机场需要多少钱？
（A）从这里走30分钟。
（B）一辆车马上要出发了。
（C）成人票5美元。
Q How much will it cost me to get to the airport by bus?
A It's five dollars one way.
坐大巴去机场要花多少钱？
—单程是5美元。

questions.question: Where do you usually get your hair done?
options: From a hairstylist I know.
I don't like my hair long.
Usually once a month. 你通常在哪里做头发？
questions.script:
Where do you usually get your hair done?
（A）From a hairstylist I know.
（B）I don't like my hair long.
（C）Usually once a month.
你通常在哪里做头发？
（A）在一个我认识的发型师那里。
（B）我不喜欢留长发。
484

（C）一般是一个月一次。
Q Is there a place you regularly go to get your hair done?
A Yes, to a hair salon near my house.
你定期到某个地方做头发吗？
—是的，到我家附近的一个美发店。

questions.question: When do you plan to go back to work?
options: I'll go back with you.
My doctor says in two weeks.
I get off at five o'clock today. 你计划什么时候回去工作？
questions.script:
When do you plan to go back to work?
（A）I'll go back with you.
（B）My doctor says in two weeks.
（C）I get off at five o'clock today.
你计划什么时候回去工作？
（A）我会和你一起回去。
（B）我的医生说两周之后。
（C）我今天5点下车的。
Q When are you thinking of returning to work?
A I should recover in a couple of weeks.
你想什么时候回去上班？
—我应该过几周就会康复。

questions.question: Where did Michelle say she was born?
options: She doesn't know it yet.
Yes, she grew up there.
I think she is French. 米歇尔说她是在哪里出生的？
questions.script:
Where did Michelle say she was born?
（A）She doesn't know it yet.
（B）Yes, she grew up there.
（C）I think she is French.
米歇尔说她是在哪里出生的？
（A）她还不知道。
（B）是的，她在那儿长大。
（C）我想她是法国人。
Q Where is Michelle's birthplace?
A She was born in Paris.
米歇尔的出生地是哪里？
—她出生在巴黎。

questions.question: Who is going to be at the party tonight?
options: Everyone will be there.
The party is going to be great. 485
To celebrate our tenth anniversary. 今晚谁要去参加聚会？
questions.script:

（A）Everyone will be there.
（B）The party is going to be great.
485

（C）To celebrate our tenth anniversary.
今晚谁要去参加聚会？
（A）每个人都会到那儿。
（B）聚会将会非常棒。
（C）为了庆祝我们的十周年纪念日。
Q Who is going to show up to the party this evening?
A Everyone should be coming.
谁会出现在今晚的聚会上？
—每个人都会来。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: When will you have the report ready?
options: I report directly to Mr. Singh.
Yes, you can give it to me.
I'll have it on your desk by noon. 你什么时候能把报告准备好？
questions.script:
When will you have the report ready?
（A）I report directly to Mr. Singh.
（B）Yes, you can give it to me.
（C）I'll have it on your desk by noon.
你什么时候能把报告准备好？
（A）我直接向辛格先生报告。
（B）是的，你可以把它给我。
（C）我会在中午之前把它放到你桌上。
Q When are you going to finish the report?
A I'll get it to you before lunch.
你什么时候能完成这个报告？
—我会在午饭前拿给你。

questions.question: Do you want to work this Saturday, or should I get John to fill in for you?
options: The work is not too bad.
This weekend is perfect.
I'll come in if you'd like. 你想这周六上班，还是我让约翰代替你？
questions.script:

（A）The work is not too bad.
（B）This weekend is perfect.
（C）I'll come in if you'd like.
你想这周六上班，还是我让约翰代替你？
（A）这份工作不错。
（B）这周末就很好。
（C）如果你想要我来，我就来。
Q Can you work the Saturday shift, or do you want me to ask John to come in
486

instead?
A I can come in.
你能上周六的班吗，还是你想要我让约翰来替你？
—我可以来。

options: I'll take it for you.
Julie, your insurance agent.
I am expecting him today. 我出去的时候谁来过？
questions.script:
Who came by while I was out?
（A）I'll take it for you.
（B）Julie, your insurance agent.
（C）I am expecting him today.
我出去的时候谁来过？
（A）我会替你拿着它。
（B）朱莉，你的保险经纪人。
（C）我今天在等他。
Q Who dropped in to see me while I was on the road?
A Your insurance rep, Julie.
我在路上的时候谁来拜访过我？
—你的保险代理人，朱莉。

questions.question: Could you do me a favor and close the window a little?
options: Next to the window, thanks.
Sure, I can do that.
Yes, they are very close. 你能帮我个忙把窗户关上一点儿吗？
questions.script:
Could you do me a favor and close the window a little?
（A）Next to the window, thanks.
（B）Sure, I can do that.
（C）Yes, they are very close.
你能帮我个忙把窗户关上一点儿吗？
（A）窗户旁边，谢谢。
（B）当然，我可以这么做。
（C）好的，它们离得很近。
Q Could you please shut the window a bit?
A Yes, of course.
你能把窗户关上一点儿吗？
—好的，当然可以。

Today is not a good day.

（A）He called in sick.
（B）I saw it many times.
（C）Today is not a good day.
487

今天有人看见比尔吗？
（A）他打电话请病假了。
（B）我看见它许多次了。
（C）今天是糟糕的一天。
Q Did Bill come in to the office today?
A He is at home in bed.
比尔今天来办公室了吗？
—他今天卧床在家。

I'll think it over tonight.

questions.script:

（A）At the reception desk.

你觉得咱们的新接待员怎么样？
（A）在前台。
（B）我今晚会仔细考虑。
（C）我还没有见过她。
Q How do you feel about our new receptionist?
A I didn' t get a chance to talk to her yet.
你觉得咱们新来的接待员怎么样？
—我还没有机会和她说话呢。

questions.question: How did your meeting with your client go?
options: Yes, let's take off.
It went better than I expected.

（C）他一个小时前走的。

A Yes, it went very smoothly.
你和客户的会面进行得顺利吗？
—是的，进行得很顺利。
488

questions.question: I finally got a hold of the manager.
options: How did you pull that off?
They hold it for a month.
He doesn't work there anymore. 我最后找到经理了。
questions.script:

（A）How did you pull that off?
（B）They hold it for a month.

我最后找到经理了。
（A）你怎么做到的？
（B）他们将其保存了一个月。
（C）他再也不在那儿工作了。

A How did you manage that?
我终于和经理谈话了。
—你怎么做到的？

questions.question: When is the game supposed to start?
options: When the rain lets up a little.
The game is going to be great.
Between Boston and New York. 比赛什么时候开始？
questions.script:
When is the game supposed to start?
（A）When the rain lets up a little.
（B）The game is going to be great.
（C）Between Boston and New York.
比赛什么时候开始？
（A）雨小一点儿的时候。
（B）比赛将会很精彩。
（C）在波士顿队和纽约队之间。

A As soon as the rain stops.

—雨一停就开始。

questions.question: Weren't you a bit concerned about Jack being absent today?
options: That's too bad.
He is worried.
No, he called in. 杰克今天没来，你一点儿也不担心吗？
questions.script:
Weren't you a bit concerned about Jack being absent today?
（A）That's too bad.
（B）He is worried.
（C）No, he called in.
杰克今天没来，你一点儿也不担心吗？
（A）那太糟糕了。
（B）他很担心。
（C）不担心，他打过电话了。
489

Q Weren't you a little worried about Jack not showing up to work today?
A No, he phoned me this morning.
杰克今天没来上班，你一点儿也不担心吗？
—不担心，他今天早上给我打电话了。

questions.question: Would you be willing to take a trip to Mexico on company expense?
options: Was it that expensive?
What's the occasion?
He is well trained. 公司出钱的话，你愿意出差去一趟墨西哥吗？
questions.script:
Would you be willing to take a trip to Mexico on company expense?
（A）Was it that expensive?
（B）What's the occasion?
（C）He is well trained.
公司出钱的话，你愿意出差去一趟墨西哥吗？
（A）会花很多钱吗？
（B）是什么事情呢？
（C）他受了很好的训练。
Q Would you be willing to go to Mexico if the company paid for your trip?
A Sure, but why do you want me to take the trip?
如果公司出钱，你愿意去墨西哥出差吗？
—当然，但是你为什么想让我出差呢？

questions.question: Where should I go to get this approved?
options: Your best bet is to speak to John.
You have to prove it first.

（A）Your best bet is to speak to John.
（B）You have to prove it first.

我应该到哪儿去获得批准呢？
（A）你最好去和约翰谈谈。

A John is the person you are looking for.
我到哪儿能获得授权呢？
—约翰是你要找的人。

questions.question: How do you get along with your boss?
options: I will bring it along tomorrow.
He is very kind to me.
Yes, he's my manager.

（A）I will bring it along tomorrow.
（B）He is very kind to me.
（C）Yes, he's my manager.
490

你和老板相处得怎么样？
（A）我明天会把它带来。
（B）他对我非常好。
（C）是的，他是我的经理。

A Yes, he's very nice to me.
你和老板相处得好吗？
—是的，他对我很好。

options: As soon as Terry comes to replace me.

I still need a little more time. 你想几点出发？

（C）I still need a little more time.
你想几点出发？

（B）现在是6:05。
（C）我还需要一点儿时间。

A When Terry shows up to take over.
你打算几点走？
—特里来接替我的时候。

questions.question: Where can I find the person in charge around here?
options: We can charge it on his account.
He stepped out for a moment.
I will get it for you in a second. 我在哪儿能找到负责人？
questions.script:

（B）He stepped out for a moment.
（C）I will get it for you in a second.
我在哪儿能找到负责人？
（A）我们可以把这个记在他的账上。
（B）他暂时出去了。
（C）我马上把它拿来给你。

你的经理在哪儿？

491

questions.question: I'd rather go to the conference next time, wouldn't you?
options: Yes, I am really looking forward to it.
There will be so many people there.

我宁愿下次再去开会，你呢？

我在想不去参加这个会议了，你呢？

questions.question:
Were you planning on making a trip to our head office, or is Mr. King coming

options: We are going to plan it soon.
Mr. King might be the person to talk to.
I'm supposed to meet him at his office. 你计划出差到我们的总部去，还是金先生到这儿来？
questions.script:
Were you planning on making a trip to our head office, or is Mr. King coming
here?
（A）We are going to plan it soon.
（B）Mr. King might be the person to talk to.
（C）I'm supposed to meet him at his office.
你计划出差到我们的总部去，还是金先生到这儿来？

你会出差去我们的总部，还是金先生应该到这儿来？
—我约好在他的办公室见面。

options: Sure, that sounds good to me.

（C）I will need it back soon.
你不想回来之前顺路去一趟商店吗？

492

（B）不，不是我把它扔掉的。

何不在回去的路上去一趟商店？

options: He often hesitates.
I'll keep that in mind, thanks.
Sure, I will give you an answer soon. 如果你需要什么，不必犹豫，问我就可以。

（B）I'll keep that in mind, thanks.
（C）Sure, I will give you an answer soon.
如果你需要什么，不必犹豫，问我就可以。

（B）我会记住的，谢谢。

A Thanks, I really appreciate it.
如果需要帮助，你可以随时打电话。

options: Three o'clock would be okay with me.
Yes, I'd like a morning call, please.
Sure，I could drive down to get you. 我要登记一下时间，你是上午来还是下午来？

Questions 38 through 40 refer to the following conversation.
M: After searching for weeks, I'm so relieved to say that we have finally
found a person to take over John's position. His name is Henry Chow.（38）
W: You see, I told you not to worry too much about it. I knew it was only a
matter of time before we found someone. Anyway, where did you ever find this
497

guy?
M: Well, we took out ads in the local paper and on Internet sites without much
luck. We even contacted several job agencies but got nothing. But to our surprise,
we found this guy from one of our branch offices.（39）Mr. Taylor went to see
Ms. Simpson in our North Town branch office and saw Henry and liked him right
away. After talking with him for several minutes, he decided to hire him right there
and then. Anyway, he is going to start next Monday.（40）
W: Wow, that's quite a story. I can't wait to meet him.
M：找了几个星期，我们终于找到接替约翰的人了，这下我就放心了。
他叫亨利·乔。
W：你瞧，我告诉过你别太担忧了。我就知道这只是时间问题，我们最
后会找到人的。对了，你们在哪儿找到这个人的？
M：哦，我们在当地报纸上和网站上登了广告，都没有收获。我们甚至
还联系了几家职业介绍所，但也没有结果。我们很意外地在一个分公司找到
了这个人。泰勒先生到我们的北城分公司见辛普森女士的时候看到了亨利，
立刻就喜欢上他了。和他谈了几分钟以后，他当场就决定聘用他。不管怎么
说，他下周一开始上班。
W：哇，这真令人难以置信。我等不及要见他了。

间的问题 to one's surprise 令人惊奇的是 replacement 代替者

W: Hey, I heard you finally landed yourself a job. How did you manage to
do that?（44）

employment agencies and had been reading the classified ads section of the
newspaper every day for the last few weeks without having any luck. Then, I got
this phone call from a friend of mine I hadn't talked to since I graduated from
college. He told me that he started a company and he wanted me to help him
out.（45）
W: Wow, that is a bit far-fetched. How long has it been since you graduated?
501

M: It's been four years.（46）I guess I am really lucky to get this chance
since the job market is terrible nowadays.

业介绍所，几周以来每天都读报纸上的分类广告栏，但是毫无结果。后来，
我接到一个电话，是我大学毕业后一直没联系过的一个朋友打来的。他告诉
我他开了一家公司，想让我去帮忙。
W：哇，那真有点儿不可思议。你毕业多久了？
M：四年了。我想我得到这个机会真的很幸运，因为当前的就业市场太
不景气了。

Hello, this is Rob McKenzie here at FM-99.99 with the morning traffic report.

Attention, all maintenance staff.（74）Please listen carefully to the
following important announcement. As you know, today is the day of the special
meeting for all maintenance and engineering staff. The meeting will be held at the
advertised time of 10:00 a.m. However, there has been a change of venue due to the
damage to Building 5 caused by last night's storm. The meeting will now be held in
the cafeteria. I repeat, today's meeting will not be held in the Building 5
conference room but has been moved to the cafeteria.（75）That should
please many of you because coffee will be available!（76）The meeting time
will, however, be shortened in order to allow the repair teams to continue working
on the Building 5 roof. Thanks.

今天所有维修和工程人员要开一个特别会议。会议将在通知过的时间——上

议时间会缩短，给维修组留出时间继续处理5号楼的楼顶。谢谢。

Questions 77 through 79 refer to the following talk.
Today we have a wonderful walking tour of the sights of this fascinating place.
We will begin with a breakfast together at the Orchid Café.（77）We suggest
that you take advantage of the buffet offerings because you will need all of
522

your energy for all the activities we have planned this morning.（78）Directly
after breakfast, we will be walking up Jacob's Ladder to King's Park. It's quite a
steep climb. From Rotary Lookout, you will get a stunning view across the city and
the river and up to the hills. We will then continue through the gorgeous natural trail
deep into the park to the wild herb garden. Here you will find a unique collection
of native foods and flowers. So please enjoy a hearty breakfast, and then we
can get started.（79）
今天我们要进行一次很棒的徒步旅行，观赏这里的美景。首先我们一起

们为你们安排的所有活动会让你们用上所有的能量。早饭后，我们直接沿雅
各布长梯到国王公园。长梯非常陡。在旋转看台上，大家可以观赏到城市、
河流以及群山的美景。然后我们继续沿着美妙的天然小径去往公园深处的野
生植物园。在这里大家会看到当地各种各样独特的食品和鲜花。所以，请大
家享用丰盛的早餐，然后开始我们的旅程。

Questions 83 through 85 refer to the following excerpt from a talk.
Good morning, everybody. Last night was the annual general meeting of
our shareholders,（84）and the topic of discussion was about the future of this
enterprise.（83）As you know, our profits have fallen dramatically. However, the
good news is that nobody doubts that the company can be turned around. The
meeting decided on a course of action aimed at reducing costs and increasing
sales. In order to achieve this, a team of consultants will be visiting the
company's operations over the next five days. They will then write a report
recommending specific actions.（85）We trust that you will give them your full
cooperation. Thank You.
大家早上好。昨晚召开了我们的年度全体股东大会，讨论的话题是我们
企业的未来。大家知道，我们的利润下降得很厉害。但是，好消息是所有人
都相信公司能够渡过难关。会议决定采取一系列措施降低成本，增加销售
量。为了达到这个目标，一个顾问组会在未来五天内视察公司的运营情况。
他们随后会撰写一份报告，提出具体的行动建议。我们相信大家会全力配合
他们。谢谢。

In addition to our regular menu, I would like to point out the day's Chef
Special.（86）All of the menu items are part of a set including a choice of
salad or vegetables,（87）a glass of house red or white wine, and a cup of
brewed coffee. Chicken, veal, and lamb are all on offer today. The chicken is

Good morning. This is Karen Holmes, Mr. Reid's secretary. I'm sorry to
disturb you Mr. Stokes, but Mr. Reid just called from the airport to tell me that
his plane has been delayed by fog.（92）The airport anticipates that the fog will
lift sufficiently by ten o'clock for planes to be able to take off. So there will be a
delay of at least two hours in Mr. Reid's itinerary. He could well arrive in New
York at one o'clock in the afternoon.（93）That would mean that he will miss
lunch but should have no problem arriving in time for the afternoon meeting. I will
call you back after ten to let you know the situation. Oh, and do you have a cell
phone number on which you can be contacted?（94）Thanks. I'll speak to you
later, Mr. Stokes.

Thank you, everybody, for coming to my workshop. Because the theme of
this summer's event is alternative energy,（95）we're going to do a hands-on
activity which I'm pretty sure you will enjoy. We're going to spend the next hour or
so making solar ovens. That's right. One hour from now, you'll have made an oven
that doesn't require electricity or gas to operate. It only needs the light of the sun.
Unfortunately, since the weather is overcast today,（96）we can't go outside to
use them, but as soon as there's a sunny day, you'll be able to test them
yourselves.（97）So let's get started.
谢谢大家来参加我的研讨会。鉴于本次夏季活动的主题是新能源，所以
我们今天要请大家一起来做个动手实践活动，相信大家会喜欢的。接下来的
一个小时左右，我们要做一台太阳能灶。大家没听错，从现在开始，一个小
时后，你们就能做出一台不需要电或天然气也能发电的太阳能灶。只要有太
阳光，它就能发电。遗憾的是，今天是阴天，所以我们不能去户外实验了。
但只要天一晴，大家就能亲手测试自己的成果了。好啦，大家开始吧。
